definition: lit. to enjoy the beautiful spring scenery (idiom)/fig. to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: He tomcatted around before settling down.
They had come to the world's most famous pick-up joint.
sentences.chinese: 他们来到了全世界最有名的寻花问柳之地。

sentences.english: Eg. He was pleased that she should think he had been a sad dog.
sentences.chinese: 他很高兴，她竟认为他曾经是个寻花问柳的人。

sentences.english: I didn't fault a man for chasing tail.
sentences.chinese: 我并不因为他寻花问柳而责怪他。

sentences.english: He can is opposite the wife is disloyal , go round singsong houses to also not matter outside.
sentences.chinese: 他可以对妻子不忠，在外面寻花问柳也无关紧要。

definition: lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
to hang around/to fool around/to live aimlessly
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation
(of a flower) to attract bees and butterflies/(fig.) to attract the opposite sex/to flirt
distinguished and accomplished/outstanding/talented in letters and unconventional in lifestyle/romantic/dissolute/loose
to go courting/to visit a brothel (old)/related to 野遊|野游[ye3 you2]
to chase women/to express oneself in a pompous flowery style
